messages.subject: KAYCEE MADE IT!  HURRAY!
messages.msgSnippet: Now I can sleep!  My dearest daughter made it all the way to Montana!  She s in Billings now.  Will stay in hotel for the night, then meet Glenn Storrs, Ph. D.
messages.messageBody:
Now I can sleep! My dearest daughter made it all the way to Montana! She's
in Billings now. Will stay in hotel for the night, then meet Glenn Storrs,
Ph. D. Director of Science Research & Curator of Vertebrate Paleontology &
Director of the Cincinnati Museum Center's Dinosaur Field School in Montana. He'll
be training them first, then taking them to their cabins (7000 feet above sea
level) then to the dig site on the Northwest flank of the Bighorn Mountains
of south-central Montana. At some point during the week they will also be
going to Yellowstone National Park.

As I hear more from her, I'll let you all know (though, LOL, I doubt I'll
hear from her much; it sounded like she was having just too much fun already--she
already said it's the most fun she's had on ANY trip she's EVER taken, so I
take that as "mom, I won't be calling you, tehe).

Anyway, thanks for thinking of her/us and for all your prayers for a safe
trip out. I know she'll be fine, but it's just a mother's worry.

Tracy

We forfeit three-fouths of ourselves in order to be like other people.

~Arthur Schopenhauer~


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
